Detailed Description

template<class type>
struct boost::logging::logger_holder_by_value< type >

Allows using a log without knowing its full type yet. Even if the log is not fully defined, you can still use it.

This will allow you to log messages even if you don't know the full type of the log (which can aid compilation time).

This keeps the logger by value, so that the after_being_destroyed stuff works. More specifically, in case the logger is used after it's been destroyed, the logger_holder instances CAN ONLY BE GLOBAL.
